fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Website down
____________________________________________

We have been informed by our customer services department that Ecorp's EXTERNAL WEBSERVER is unreachable by our customers. You will need to get it back up and public so that our customers can reach it.
With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Ecorp's webservers

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Security Concern
____________________________________________

I was talking to one of my associates who had just read an article concerning system security and benner information. According to the article, systems without specific version information in their banners were 20% less likely to get attacked. That sounds like a "pretty good odds in our favor" type of thing so I want you to remove any specific program or version information from the banners of all out publicly visible servers (web.mail, etc). Use something generic for the banners like "Ecorp mail server" and "ECorp web server." Be sure to use something generic on the other services as well. You might want to include a warning that we're monitoring connections and will prosecute intruders as well. I am thinking this sounds like something your team can have done in maybe 60 minutes. Document for our record keeping

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Service Banners

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Copyright material
_____________________________________

It has come to our attention that illegally obtained media material has been identified on our network. An impending review requires that this be taken care of in 30 minutes. Report where each file was located for HR.

With Regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Copyright material

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Team meeting
____________________________________________

The CEO wants to have an emergency meeting with your team leader about some new discoveries with the company's infrastructure. He just me with the board of directories and there are many tasks that need to be done to ensure the stability and continuity of the business.

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Team lead meeting

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Migrate subnet
____________________________________________

We have detected that there has been some malicious activity on our network. We have been recommended to migrate our subnet. We want you to make the subnet 10.173.70.0/24. Also put up forwarding so our customers can still contact us.

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Migrate subnet

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: New employees
____________________________________________

Ecorp is expanding and just added on a load of employees. We need you to add 200 users to the network. We need 100 new users(10 have Admin privileges) to Active Directory, 25 new users(3 have Admin privileges) to the internal webserver so they can log on to the website. 25 new users(3 have Admin privileges) to the external webserver and 50 new users(2 have root access) to the Kali machine to allow our It team to work.

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Add users

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Mail server
____________________________________________

We have recently discovered a mail server on our network. I want you to check this out. It needs to be secured and configured so that our employees can access it from home so they can work and communicate with other employees about projects. 

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Mail server

fields.details:
From: The desk of the President
To: Systems Administration Team
Subject: Backup Web server
____________________________________________

As a part of infrastructure upgrades, a Sys Admin from a third party vendor we hired has added an Apache Server to the infrastructure that is to be configured to fail-over if the original Apache server goes down. After he implemented this, he was found to be in violation of his employment contract with us and has since been fired. Please finish configuring the Apache server to fail-over the company's server as a part of improving our company's business continuity plan.

With regards,
Company President
fields.subject: Backup Apache
